ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
- Interest in public health 
- Role of media in public health 
- General knowledge on public health

I learned more about current public health issues and what the landscape in this field looks like. I was able to hear from people who are experts in the field and gained insight into what kinds of problems our society currently faces in this area.
many issues plaguing public health today
I learned a lot about the history and current states of a lot of the biggest topics in medicine. Pretty surface level because we covered so many topics, but I appreciated the knowledge.

I developed a lot of knowledge about epidemiology and the major issues in public health. I now understand how to analyze the journalistic response to these issues and crises and how to analyze the official response.
I learned more about how to appropriately talk about public health issues.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
- Classroom lessons = sometimes ineffective
- Interesting and good depth of material
- Good guest lecturers

The course wasn't extremely stressful, which definitely made it easier to enjoy and participate in class discussions without having to worry about the grade or the heavy workload. One downside was that there was a tad bit too much reading assigned each class, and we didn't seem to get to discuss everything that was assigned.

strengths were class discussions were interesting and engaging, readings were varied and interesting, discussion posts were good for evaluating students understanding of topic; some readings were unnecessary and never mentioned in discussions so can be omitted in the future

The quiz format was definitely tough and expectations are not super clearly expressed. Sorting that out at the beginning of the semester could be helpful. With good participation in class and engagement with the essays, the class is most enjoyable.
I wish that there were less memory quizzes.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, helpful to gauge interest in public health

I would recommend this class if you are looking for a broad overview of current issues in medicine and public health. The class does not go extremely in-depth, so it is more so a general survey course.

yes, instructor is very good at facilitating discussions and creates variation in the way each class is held, which makes class more fun and engaging, and many topics in public health are discussed which are interesting and relevant today

Definitely yes for what it is! Great way to fulfill a science credit, learn useful knowledge, without too much work or strain. Sure to be an entertaining class even if not the standard first year seminar.
Yes, it is a really cool FYS taught by a prof. with lots of great knowledge and experience!
